actual_address: 85 Rue John F. Kennedy, Saint-Jérôme, QC J7Y 4B5, Canada

reviews.text:
I had one of the best experiences with Mike David. One of the most knowledgeable people I’ve dealt with. Extremely friendly and looks out for his clients to the best of his abilities. I felt like he would go above and beyond for me and I’m sure I’m not the only one.

He made sure that everything went as smoothly as possible and everything just felt very easy and I didn’t feel like I had to keep my head on a swivel in any way.

Since the very beginning of the interaction I felt very at ease with him as he made sure I had all the information I needed to make an informed decision.

If I ever need anything from Volkswagen, I’ll be sure to go to Mike as I know he’ll do all he can to help.

Thank you Mike!

Once upon a time I got my car from here and I was happy with the sales and the service for a little while, it was my favourite place to come if I needed work on the car.

The people at the garage changed since and unfortunately I have only outrageously bad experiences.

I had a taillight that kept going out. I replaced the fuse and took it in for service. They charged me a diagnostic fee to tell me they don't know what the problem is and to bring it in with a blown fuse. So I did that, and they charged me another diagnostic fee and then  hundreds to replace some part. I still have the same problem. It seems like a basic issue but dangerous, I only know it's out when cars flash and drivers honk and wave me. And I have no trust to take it back there.

Next, I described a ventilation issue I had, they charged me a diagnostic fee, then told me I'm imagining. So I sat them in the car and showed how the driver side does not blow air. They charged me another diagnostic fee and gave me an estimate of $1700. Spoiler alert: the friggin' vent had the plastic lever snapped in two, so I don't know what qualifications you need that you can't diagnose such a "subtle issue", but hey it's hard work apparently. The reason I didn't have it fixed there was their unprofessionalism and attitude. And I am glad they behaved like that because surprise and shock was when I had that resolved at another service for $450 total, OEM parts and everything. VW sells the part for 200 lol and to replace it was a half an hour work. I understand difference in prices because one place is more fancy. But a quote 4 times the cost? How can anyone justify that??? Cost me more to pay for pseudodiagnostic than to have it fixed somewhere else. Btw, I asked if I can have a second diagnostic waived since the first time they were incapable of diagnosing anything: of course NO.
Also btw, the guy with the ponytail: bad attitude and incompetent.
So yeah, I am done. Never again doing business here.

In march of this year a sales rep got us to come in to the dealership (which took over two hours to get though and they knew this) based off of a trade quote we were given. Upon arrival the manager let us know they gave us the wrong number and never even checked the VIN before our 2+ hour drive. He said he needed our permission but never got me to sign anything different once I got there and wasted a total of 4-5 hours of driving and basically just said too bad.

My experience purchasing a car from  volkswagen Laurentides was excellent. The salesman was Marianne and helped me through the entire purchase. She was fast to answer all my questions and helped out as much as she could. I highly recommend working with Marianne to purchase your next vehicle!

Thank you to Shannie is sales, Mike the Sales Manager, and Julie in Finance.
Purchased a pre-owned Tiguan. I had an amazing experience with the team at Volkswagen St Jerome. Highly recommend!

reviews.text:
I recently purchased a 2022 jetta from them , and I unfortunately had a very negative experience. While the initial buying process seemed smooth, I later discovered that the vehicle was sold to me with severely damaged brake rotors. This oversight ended up costing me a significant amount of money to fix, and I’m extremely disappointed that a reputable dealership would sell a car in such condition.

I would highly recommend that potential buyers inspect their vehicles thoroughly before finalizing any deals here, as it seems quality control is lacking. I have attached pictures of the damaged rotors as evidence to show what I had to deal with after purchase.

It’s important for buyers to be aware that what might seem like a good deal could end up being a costly mistake. Do your research and make sure you check every detail before buying from this dealership.
I will suggest to go somewhere else to save your money.

5 star dealership!
From the very first appointment. Very knowledgeable staff. Maxime was impeccable with everything. From the selection of the car as well as with the negotiations with my trade in. He even called the day before the pick up to advise of a new promotion reducing my interest rate of 1%. Worth waiting an extra day! Honest and transparent. Helpful and super kind. Definitely recommend.
Thanks Maxime!!

I purchased a used vehicle with my daughter (19) at this dealership. She is a university student and Team Canada sport athlete. She travels on the road a lot and requires a reliable and economic car. Her car of choice was a used Tesla and she found one at this dealership. The salesperson Sebastien was very courteous and made it a point to interact with her. She took it out for a test drive, liked it very much and decided to purchase it. We were told that the price included a set of winter tires that were in the car. We also negotiated some minor repairs.  This part of the experience was very good. However, the actual transaction was quite difficult at times with unreturned calls, no answer and no voice mail. We did however persevere and eventually made arrangements for vehicle pick. We drove two hours for the pick up. Once there, we were greeted by another (courteous salesperson) but were surprised to find that the tires we negotiated were no longer in the car. We were told that they were in storage and that the manager would email us with details for pick. That email never came. When we followed up with the salesperson, we were told that they threw out the tires and no longer had them (too used). My issue with all of this lies in the negotiated price (which included the tires), the fact that we did not receive what was agreed upon and that the dealership never communicated the change with us. We have since followed up to express our disappointment. There has not been a response. Very unfortunate and unpleasant experience.

The folks at VW Lauzon were absolutely fantastic. From the receptionist to the sales director, everyone was very kind and professional. Any questions I had were answered and everything was well explained to me.

My family has been loyal to Lauzon for over 20 years and it is for good reasons. I highly suggest this dealership of you are in the market for a VW.

Word of advice: there is a lot of rush hour traffic around the location. So if you do a test drive, try to go outside of rush hours.

Nice before you purchase, Not there after the purchase

I had a mixed experience with VW Lauzon Blainville. They were very friendly and accommodating before I made the purchase, but things changed after the sale.

The dealership was supposed to fix an issue with the rear camera before I took possession of the vehicle. Instead, they ended up using my newly purchased warranty to address it after the fact, which was not the arrangement we had.

Then, within the first 6 months (10,000 km) of owning the vehicle, I encountered problems with the air conditioning. I called my salesperson twice for help, but neither call was returned. It’s disappointing to feel ignored and left to deal with issues on my own once the sale was finalized.

While they were helpful during the buying process, the post-purchase support has been lacking. If you choose to buy from here, just be aware that customer service might not be as responsive once you’ve signed the papers.

I had an excellent buying experience thanks to Jihad. He was friendly, professional, and extremely helpful, making the entire process smooth and stress-free. I highly recommend him!

I had an excellent experience at Volkswagen Lauzon Boisbriand. Sébastien, the sales rep, was incredibly nice and helpful, guiding me through the process with patience and knowledge and a great deal. Jean-Mathieu, the manager, ensured I got a great deal and was transparent throughout. Both went above and beyond, making the entire car-buying experience smooth and enjoyable. Highly recommend! If you're in the market for a new or used car, Boisbriand Volks is definitely worth considering. Mr. Ali hamade  provided exceptional service, was very helpful, and there was no pressure to make a purchase. I strongly recommend buying a car from here.

actual_address: 210 QC-132, Saint-Constant, QC J5A 2C9, Canada

reviews.text: JUST wow. I have had dozens of cars and have been to dozens of dealership and nothing beats VW St-Constant. Brought my egolf for servicing today. My heater didn’t work and it’s a heat sensor or something but this isn’t the point. There is a recall so they will tackle at the same time to save me money. This isn’t it. It’s getting close to winter so Killian doesn’t only adapt, he also thinks and all he thinks about is CUSTOMER SERVICE. Piece isn’t ready yet but he was trying to work something out instead of re-scheduling the appointment to the point of looking for a courtesy car for them to keep it to get the job done. Plain and simple, GREAT customer service is what it’s all about. You don’t only buy a car. The service is key. GOOD JOB!

Saw a car on their website and made an appointment to see it. Two minutes later, I get a text telling me the car has been sold. Ok, whatever... The guy calls me back and convinces me to come anyway, promising that I'll be able to come look at about 10 cars. I get there, and they have all of three cars, none of which fit what I was looking for. The person there (different person) was really nice, but clearly no one told him I was coming (he was very surprised). Nice lip service, horrible actual service
The first guy knew I was coming from Montreal by bus, I didn't need to decide to buy a car to be happy, but at least make sure you have cars on site

I brought my golf r here to replace my wheel bearing which was covered under warranty. Everything was all good until the service advisor Melanie lied to me. Went to pick up the loaner car and asked if I could grab something out of my golf r. My car was no where to be found. The whole dealership had no idea where my car was (they did, they just didn’t want to tell me what happened) the sales person, Mohammed was also lying to me just to get me off his case about where my car was, eventually after going in multiple times last weekend they finally told me my car was at a body shop. Which it had no reason to be and no one told me why it was there. I went to see my car for myself, they damaged my side skirt and weren’t planning on painting it at first, they were just planning on reattaching it and acting like nothing happened even though it was pretty scratched up as well as the clear coat was chipping off… I’ve had my whole car ceramic coated which they did not know about and I would have eventually noticed as I am a detailer and I take very good care of my golf r. I was very disappointed that the service advisor Melanie did not tell me what was going on. Instead she told me the wheel bearing was defective and they had to order another one which is why my car was taking so long when really one of the mechanics just damaged my car. The service manager Christian was great. He got my car repaired and everything was fixed. I don’t recommend coming here and if you do, do not trust the service advisor Melanie unless you’re okay with dishonesty. I have gotten services done at many Volkswagens and I have never come across a service advisor lying to the clients. This was not ok.
The best deal ever. Tym is the best salesman by far. He manage to get me a great deal on my brand new car. Couldnt be more happy. A++

This is the best car dealer I ever deal with. Miguel & sales manager Tim gave me a excellent service & warm welcome. First time buying a VW at this dealership & it won't be the last time. A++ customer service.

reviews.text: Bought my car at beginning of February used and have had zero issues. Thank you to Mathieu the salesperson personality and the entire team volkswagen (director, both financial associates) for your amazing service, patience and dedication.

Avoid Grenier Volkswagen in Mascouche at All Costs!

I had the absolute worst experience with the sales team, particularly Mathieu, the Sales Director, and Xavier, the Sales Associate. They engaged in dishonest sales tactics from the start. We negotiated a rental contract with a monthly payment that fit my budget, and I left a deposit on the car. However, despite repeatedly asking for a copy of the detailed rental contract, I only received it 24 hours later after persistent follow-ups.

To my shock, the contract omitted a crucial detail — the winter tires, which they later quoted me at $2300! This raised my monthly payment by $125 more than what we had initially agreed upon. After discussing their lack of transparency and how they were essentially trying to corner me into a deal we hadn’t fully discussed, I asked to back out of the contract and requested my $500 deposit back.

It’s now been 3 days, and I’ve yet to receive any communication regarding my refund. The Director of Grenier Volkswagen was supposed to call me today (September 25th) but never did. I am now left having to harass them for my own money, which I suspect they plan on keeping.

If you’re in the market for a Volkswagen, save yourself the headache and **go to another dealer**. My husband and I have had 3 Volkswagens – great cars, but this dealership is a nightmare. I highly recommend Volkswagen Griffintown or Laval. We’ve had positive experiences there. Unfortunately, I made the mistake of going to Grenier Volkswagen in Mascouche, and it’s been a disaster. My husband is due to renew his lease and has now decided to go elsewhere or with a competitor — even if it means driving 25km for better service.

Save yourself the trouble and avoid this dealership!

excellent service if u need to buy or sell a carJEAN SEBASTIEN  is the salesperson to deal with! He is very professional and catering to your needs and gets the job done! If problems or complications arise, he will find the solution.

Earlier this month I received and responded to an e-mail from Jade Jutras regarding a 2019 Golf R I was inquiring about. Jade asked if I had received the previous 2 e-mails and I responded, what e-mails?  I explained a month or 4 weeks prior I called Grenier VW regarding the vehicle and was told it was sold. I was never given the salesman name and mine was never asked for either, so how do they have a record of my call? Jade responded that they did not receive the first communique from me till Sept 5th, I take it they have no clue 4 weeks earlier I called on the phone and was told it was sold. That was never considered. I was told I was confused and was thinking of another dealership. Jade knows better! I explained to Jade that, I know I am not confused here. This 2019 Carbon white R has a massive paint spill in the trunk floor and also the parcel shelf is missing. This makes it unique to all other “R”s offered in Canada. I was told a month ago that the vehicle was sold hence my frustration and confusion.

Jade’s same day response was, I don't think I deserve your frustration, especially since I'm simply trying to help you on this Saturday when no one is working since the dealership is closed. No-one asked that I be contacted on their day off. If you need a break from work then take one and if work sucks that much quit and find something else. To say Jade is fragile is an understatement!

I send my last e-mail with, There is no frustration on my end. I know what I am talking about and you are just making assumptions. If you are going to make judgements and jump to conclusions then forget about it. I will post appropriate feedback for you and let’s end it here.

I walked about from Genier VW and Jade for this car, because I hated the way I was treated. Jade is not an employee or a representative that any comany would wish to have them represent them, yet Grenier VW seems to accept this decission!!

Unimpressed by service, egotistic sales team (the ones i met) and ripped me off on the $2000 guarantee (now costs $3000). I paid for the extended guarantee to be covered until 100,000km. I came to see them right before my guarantee ended because I had been feeling a problem with my suspension. They told me there was no problem. 2 weeks later i came to see them because the problem worsened, i was around 100,500km and they said they could repair the problem for $1075+tax. I said i knew they could help me out considering I NEVER used a penny of my guarantee, and because i came to get the problem fixed BEFORE 100,000km. They said there’s nothing they can do for me and it was too bad. I literally gave them $2000 for that guarantee for absolutely no reason at all. My brother bought a car there a few weeks ago, they now raised the price to $3000.

Bought my car about 4 years ago. Havent had unusual problems with the car, but this review is for GRENIER Volkswagen dealership; not Volkswagen as a car company.

Will not be buying another car here unless the guarantee is free. Feel like i got robbed of a $2000 guarantee.

PS: the repair they wanted to charge me $1075+tax for, i got it done by another mechanic for $450 tax-in. These guys are thieves it’s disgusting.

UPDATE: Director of sales gave me a call. He didnt have the attitude of someone trying to help/make a customer satisfied; he was just trying to invalidate my review which was a terrible way to handle an unhappy customer. I speak french but sometimes have trouble finding my words, so i asked « do you speak any english » his answer, in french « on est a Mascouche donc je va m’exprimer en français » (we live in mascouche so im going to speak in french). Didn’t know he wanted to be geopolitical about helping a client, not to mention the fact that HE called ME; i wasn’t the one who wanted to talk, HE was. He did speak in english a couple minutes later, and spoke perfect english. He just didn’t WANT to earlier in the conversation because of political reasons. Clearly wasn’t doing his best to adapt to his client. He never offered me ANYTHING to try and change my mind. NOTHING. Not a free oil change, not free tire storage, not even a discount on anything. NOTHING. 30min phone call was nothing but an arrogant tone trying to validate why i got such poor service. Already wasn’t impressed with Grenier Volkswagen, now I will shop 1 hour away for my next car before i step foot in Grenier Volkswagen 5 min away from my house. If anyone in management is reading this, maybe consider hiring staff with a better notion of customer service because this phone call didnt brighten my review on Grenier Volkswagen; it made it worse.

PS: im not someone who just leaves 1star/2star reviews to hurt reputations. My reviews are honest; i have more positive reviews on my profile than bad ones. This place of business was just that bad of an experience.

reviews.text: Brand new dealership with Excellent service! One of the best dealerships I’ve ever been to. Michel and his team went out of their way to get me the vehicle I wanted. Thanks again!
Fantastic dealership - Michel, Danila and the remainder of his staff are an absolute gem to deal with. They helped me get my GTI and took well care of me. Couldn't recommend a better dealership.

I want to send out a big THANK YOU !!  to Michel and Danila.
I have been shopping online for a WRX for some time now and I finally came across the right one.
I've reached out to a number of dealerships to no avail. Either the car was sold, even though it was still posted online as available, never got a response back, or I didn't feel confident enough to go ahead with a long distance purchase, for many different reasons.

I reached out to Michel on a Sunday night and first thing Monday morning I received good news back from Michel.  He was very friendly and professional from day one.  He answered all my questions and exceeded all my expectations at the same time.  He sent me the CarFax, which was clean.  He offered to take a video showcasing the car and sent it to me.  He also took pictures of the car getting brand new brakes and rotors.  Nobody has offered me such service in the past, EVER, and without even having to ask.
Michel earned my trust and confidence that I was making the right choice.  The only thing that I had to worry about was getting to Chateauguay from NB and driving the WRX back home, over 800 kms away.
I also want to thank Danila for helping me through the financing aspect of acquiring the car.  He was also very friendly and professional.
I must say that this was the most pleasant car buying experience that I've had in over 30 yrs of driving.
The car was well priced, in great condition, low kms, brand new winter tires and looking brand new for a 2019.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!  to everyone at Volkswagen Gabriel, from the secretary who answered my calls, to the detailer for making the car look immaculate, and the mechanics for making sure that the car was safe to drive.

👍👍 ALL THE WAY!!

I dont know about all the food reviews here since this is a car dealership but I had an incredible experience that truly exceeded my expectations. During a time when most places were closed for the holidays, the team at this dealership stepped up in an extraordinary way to help me out. Their kindness, professionalism, and genuine willingness to assist made a stressful situation so much easier.

Had to constantly keep calling them and it took forever to finally get an update about what was really going on. Felt like the service could have been better, especially with the prices they charge. reviews.text: Went to Volkswagen Drummondville to look at a 2016 Honda HR-V EX-L AWD. It was our first time purchasing from a dealership. I recently purchased a used vehicle out of province from this dealership, however a week after owning the car, I found myself in a tricky situation, and on the last valid day of the Quebec temporary transit permit; on a Friday afternoon no less. When I went to plate the car in Ontario, I discovered I was missing key documents required for registration. Somehow, I left the dealer without everything. To make matters worse, I’m 3 hours away, and I couldn’t even extend it via an Ontario temporary permit without these documents, meaning the car was going off the road indefinitely.

In a panic, I made a frantic phone call back to the dealer and was fortunate enough to speak with Max Dube. Without diving into all the details, Max went above and beyond to save the day. He quickly got everything I needed, ensured I had the documents before the office closed, and made himself available throughout the entire process to ensure everything went smoothly. It’s worth mentioning this is a week after the sale as well. Thanks to his exceptional effort and willingness to go the extra mile, what could have been a week-long nightmare was resolved within hours, and I was plated and on my way with only minutes to spare.
I am very impressed with, and incredibly thankful to Max and his commitment to outstanding customer service. Thank you, Max!

Incredible experience. I was taking care of from start to finish like a king.

Marc-Antoine took care of all my needs and questions when it came to the purchase of the vehicule. Including polishing the vehicule, too making sure any cosmetic damage were taken care of.

When it came to the financing ive never had a better experience with some then with Maxime Dube, he answered all my questions from start to finish. He took time to explain all my questions.

I would highly recommande doing business with Marc-Antoine and Maxime Dube again, it was a smooth, easy and incredible transaction from start to finish.

Thanks again :)

My father purchased a vehicle from here and  we were SO satisfied with the experience. We are from Ontario and everyone at the dealership was welcoming, helpful, and knowledgeable. They sent us pictures and videos of the car before we arrived, explained everything about the vehicle and licensing, and provided different options for payment. There was a minor issue but the Manager fixed it immediately and explained to us what happened (we thought there was a leak but it was only because the engine was washed before our arrival!)

I felt like they cared about us and wanted to make us happy. They never rushed or made us feel pressured.  The car was ready to go the same day but we needed to stay a night and they even suggested hotels!!!

Thank you to Sean, Max, and all the other folks (sorry I’ve forgotten your names!). My dad loves the car, but you made it so so much more special for him because you guys were so great!  Thank you isn’t enough!

I'm from out of province and was at a nearby shopping mall and ehrnvwe went to leave our VW Tiguan wouldn't start (would not turn over).

I googled vw nearby and this place showed up.   Called them and told them my dilema... they said I needed to get it towed to them and they would look at it either that day of the next.  Being on vacation I really didn't want to wait and worry.   They provided a phone number of a local tow truck service.   Called and they said the wait would be 1.5 hrs  while waiting a kind man saw our car hood raised and asked if everything was OK.  I hold him my story and he offered to give me a boost.

Luckily the car started and we went to Desjardins Volkswagen.   Got there and explained my situation and waited in the waiting area.  The waiting area has the same feel as my hometown VW dealership area,  this one us just smaller. Free coffee and water is always nice.

They told us it would be $69.95 + tax for a battery test.  After about 40 mins a man came to tell us the battery was dead.  The quote for a new battery, plus diagnostic and installation fee would be $320 plus tax.  Not cheap and had I been home I would have done the job myself.   20 mins later and a few hundred dollars later, we were on the road again.

I'm so thankful they could take us the same day.

In hindsight,  I should have known the battery was near end of life.  If was the original battery on a 2015 Tiguan that sees cold winters

reviews.author_name: The Deboxifier: Tech and Cryptos China
reviews.text: ...took my 2016 Tiguan there last Saturday. They promised to keep me updated on their progress (they didn't). I finally called them. I asked them to bleed the hydraulic lines serving the clutch master cylinder, and replace it if faulty. They refused to bleed the lines, and instead said it was 'likely' the release bearing was 'leaking'. They then quoted a price of 800$+---to replace it, and 150$--for diagnostic work. I told them 'ok, put a new one in'. After a pause, the service guy said, ' well, if the bearing is gone, likely the clutch needs to be replaced too...1600$+. I said 'ok', put them both in. After another pause, he said, well, if the clutch is gone, the flywheel likely has a burn mark on it too...so you should replace that too (another 1600$). Now the total had jumped from 800$ for a 'possible' release bearing replacement if it was bad, to a all new clutch and flywheel...just 'in case' they were damaged...total now over 3300$ on just 'maybes'. This was nothing more than a cash grab. I promptly told them I was on my way to pick it up without their 'work' done. I picked it up an hour later, drove back to Nova Scotia without any clutch issues..or shifting issues at all. The long and short: I would never recommend them for service...extremely overpriced...'fixing things on a 'maybe' they need replaced'...and charging me 188$ to let me know they had no clue at all if anything was actually bad or definitely needed replacing. I would never recommend them for anything except maybe the clean smell of the reception area. I gave 2 stars because the girls at the reception area were friendly...as a service center, it is a ripoff, and a complete joke.

Was required to make an "appointment" to purchase a specific vehicle. The salesperson told me not to worry as there were no other appointments to see the car. Dealership sold the vehicle an hour prior to our arrival, even though they texted us multiple times prior to the appointment to confirm our attendance. Told us too bad so sad once we arrived. Disappointing customer service to say the least. If you are forced to go, avoid Vincent and Maxine.

I wish I would of known that the parts section closed down before the actual dealership. I wasted a couple hours and whatever gas was used, only to get there 10 minutes after the parts section closed(2 hours before the dealership closes, acording to google). I will update my review when the google hours are fixed online so that others don't waste their time/money.

Broke down on a road trip, limped into Volkswagen Moncton at 5pm. They had the parts in stock and agreed to squeeze us in the following morning, even though they were fully booked. They gave us taxi vouchers to get to a hotel and back. Car was ready by 10 the next morning. Staff so helpful, knowledgeable and friendly!

reviews.text: i went to FVW looking for my very first car. i expected it to be super stressful and long process but Juliann and Brent made the whole experience feel like a breeze. they were super pleasant to talk to, explained everything very well and answered every question i had. they are a fantastic team and i’m glad my first car buying experience was with them!

2 weeks ago I called to book an inspection and to run a diagnostic test for a rear door issue. I was told it would be about an 1 hour to an hour and a half.
Last week, I dropped my car off at 12:30pm and was told it would be about 3 or 3 and a half hours.
I returned at 3:45pm to see if my car was finished, as I had planned a drive based on the new estimate of time, although I did not receive a phone call updating me on my car. At 3:45pm I was told it would be another 45 minutes. I waited outside and returned at 4:40pm. I was told the inspection was finished, and work would need to be done to pass the inspection, and that the diagnostic test was being run now.
I continued to wait for another 30 minutes,
and my car was finished at 5:10pm, 4 hours and 40 minutes after my appointment time.
While waiting I overheard that they were understaffed today. I understand these issues but the lack communication was extremely frustrating, as I had planned my day around this appointment. I will not be returning to service my car here.
The place I brought it to fix the issues had the work done in less time than it took Volkswagen to find the issues.

Our experience at Volkswagen Fredericton was seamless! From the moment My husband and I entered the building we just knew we were in the right place. A brief visit turned out to our induction into Volkswagen family. Jesse and Brent ensured we were completely satisfied and we are truly appreciative. Not very often you do go to a business establishment and honestly feel like marketers have your best interest at heart, Jesse proved otherwise! If he is selling us rocks, we r buying and will be taking family and friends too!!!😅😂. Remarkable service! Kudos!

High five 🖐️ for the folks at VW Fredericton. They honoured very well their warranty on my Tiguan 2014 that develop rust.
The  garage, “Fix auto Fredericton” did a superbe job on it with superbe service.

Another good raison to drive VW 😉

I love my local Volkswagen dealership and without a doubt Sean Pitt who works there.

He is extremely knowledgeable and knows all the small details about Volkswagen cars. Each time I have a specific question Sean Pitt is always able to answer it if not help me regarding it. Additionally, he is very kind and patient, he always ensures that he understands my request and will go out of his way to make sure that I am satisfied.
I once had a very last-minute issue with the door handle and I had to leave out of the province for the summer, I popped in the morning to see if anything could be done. Unfortunately, all the mechanics were busy and not able to have a quick look at it to see if it could be fixed easily.
However, Sean Pitt had a quick inspection of it and knew what had to be done to have it functioning again. In less than 5 minutes he had a fix and I did not have to go out of my way to book an appointment to only have that 5 minute fix for it. It was also free of charge (of course if the work scope was larger then I would have wanted to pay for it without a doubt but I was glad that a small fix like that was free of charge plus Sean Pitt took the time to torque my wheels too so that my car was good for the 14 hours drive that I had to do for my trip).
I truly appreciate his kindness and expertise, if it is out of his scope he makes sure to recommend to me what is best for my car. I am extremely thankful that he works at the Fredericton Volkswagen since Sean Pitt is amazing!

On top of that, all the experiences that I had so far have been positive at the Fredericton Volkswagen Dealership. Their new dealership setup is also very neat for quick services. Their services are very well. I always bring my 2013 Volkswagen Golf Wolfsburg Edition there for its oil change. Each time I bring it in for an oil change they do a vehicle health inspection with it, my favorite part regarding it is they record it and share it with me to visually show me the problems. As somebody who works on cars, having this information is nice as I can judge if it is something easy that I can fix or if I am better off to make an appointment with them.
All my interactions have been very transparent and I never felt "Scammed" or "Used."
Although their hourly rate is a bit on the higher end for my personal preference, I am satisfied with the results they deliver so I do not mind the extra cost.

They once repaired one of my calipers that broke, two years went by and I never had an issue with it which is awesome (Plus they were ok with using a third-party part that was from Napa to be installed on it instead of an OEM VW caliper). These kinds of results have been consistent with the other repairs I had there, not once did I have to come back due to some "XYZ" reason after getting something repaired.

Overall, thumbs up on my end and certainly to Sean Pitt for being great with his services!
For Admin, if possible it would be great if you could have this shared with Sean Pitt and for the management to see it.
Thank you!

When I visited the dealership, Heather turned the situation around completely. Her warmth, professionalism and customer-first attitude made all the difference. In less than 24 hrs my car was fixed. Heather went above & beyond!

I called in scheduled a service,  thinking what I was told was correct by the call centre. NOT SO MUCH! Insert Heather Jollimore to the rescue!!  Heather put my mind at ease and was able to get me an appointment earlier! Hats off to Heather for being AMAZING at what she does! Barry Henneberry was great to deal with at my appointment as well! Well done! I love a dealership with people who actually care 🙂 and have a personality!

The service today - as always - was terrific! I didn’t have an appointment and was heading out on a road trip to Cape Breton, and all of a sudden, a light came on and I needed something checked out. I drove straight to VW and Heather (and one of their new employees) helped me without any hesitations…or waiting! She took me aside, checked out the issue, and fixed things right then and there  ◡̈  She sent me on my way and ensured my car was ready to hit the road. The staff at VW are remarkable every single time…so thank you! It’s an absolute pleasure whenever I go in to have my car serviced, but times like today really show the ways that the VW team go above and beyond!

queried_address: Steele Volkswagen 696 Windmill Rd Dartmouth NS B3B2A5 Canada
actual_address: 696 Windmill Rd, Dartmouth, NS B3B 1H9, Canada

reviews.text: Hard to get a callback and you will be consistently overcharged for warranty work or have work done you didn't ask for. The first time I questioned an overcharge the excuse was that the video service review couldn't remove warranty charges but they assured me would be waved at payment. Well I didn't question it the second time it happened and went to pay and of course the charge was there. I had to get it removed again. I wonder how often this "mistake" happens to others. I have a 10 year history of every mistake benefiting Steele.

I was in an accident on feb 4th and needed a new vehicle. I started shopping around right away. I stumbled upon this place by randomly calling to ask some questions and spoke with Filip.

My partner and I have had an exceptional experience buying a vehicle from Steel Volkswagen in Burnside. I found that everyone at this location was kind, friendly, understanding, genuine and down to earth. I ask a lot of questions, because I like to fully understand things. Filip and Mike were helpful and patient, and took the time to answer all of the questions I had. And if they weren't sure of the answer then they found out the information for me.

I felt like they really cared about providing the best options for us and our situation. They were informative and welcomed us back if we had any questions at all. I would highly recommend checking Steel Volkswagen in Burnside out if you are looking to purchase a new or used vehicle.

Everyone seemed to be very nice and friendly at this location. I dealt with Filip and Mike with my purchase. And they were great! We were even surprised with a gift waiting for us on the back seat of our new vehicle. My hubby showed me once we arrived home. I thought that was extremely thoughtful.

We bought a pre-owned vehicle from Steele Volkswagen recently .  The salesman, Aryan, was very helpful and courteous and the rest of the staff made us feel welcome and well taken care of.  We had some small issues when we got the car home but Steele acted quickly to deal with our concerns.  If you are looking for a vehicle Steele Volkswagen is a good place to go - ask for Aryan.

I highly recommend shopping for cars at Steele Volkswagen on Windmill rd. The team made the purchasing process very pleasant. Our sale rep - Aryan - helped us browse through the pre-owned car inventory and compared the options/features base on our preferences. He listened closely to any of our concerns and tried out the cars himself to make sure everything was okay before we made the final decision. Jon - the financial manager - helped us through the paperwork process and everything was done so quickly. We got the car just after 2 days. If anyone is looking for pre-owned Hondas, i strongly recommend checking out their inventory, they have the most reasonable price in HRM.

Awful. Every single time. Have been weeks and weeks waiting on a response every time. Not even a hint of a personality on the lady who answers the phone. Bought a brand new car off the lot last year from here and will never ever again. I won't even bring it back for an oil change anymore. Wouldn't let em vacuum my car. Atrocious top to bottom. Whoever is in charge needs to have a serious look at the staffing. Everytime the excuse is "we are so busy, it's always crazy in here"!! Haha oh? Welcome to the world we live in now? Everyone's busy... we all work hard as well! in fact we do so to pay you for a service for our vehicles that we ALSO pay you for...the least you can do is your job! Rip off top to bottom. Over 15 vehicles we have bought from Steele and not another will be purchased.

queried_address: Jim Sampson Motors (1997) Limited 132 Townsend St Sydney NS B1P5E2 Canada
actual_address: 132 Townsend St, Sydney, NS B1P 5E2, Canada

reviews.text:
In addition to the issues below.  It looks like this dealership had deleted my last feedback.  Here it is again.

I have become aware of a troubling situation involving Jim Sampson Volkswagen in Sydney that raises concerns about potential negligence and predatory behavior.

An elderly acquaintance of mine, aged 71, purchased a new vehicle from this dealership and opted for an extended warranty. Unfortunately, at just 60,000 kilometers, a cooling problem surfaced, prompting multiple repair attempts over the following seven years. Despite these efforts, the issue persisted.

Upon reaching 200,000 kilometers, and after the warranty had expired, the dealership charged $2000 for another repair. Regrettably, the problem remained unresolved, echoing the initial issue encountered at 60,000 kilometers.

This pattern of events suggests a troubling lack of accountability and customer care on the part of the dealership. Currently, an investigation is underway, and legal action is being pursued to address this matter appropriately.

bad experience. So expensive labour. I left my car there for two hours to change a tire and every time I went there they checked it out. Maintenance staff often come out to chat, feel very unprofessional.

So if it gave me the option for a zero star I would have picked it...

The maintenance section of this dealership is honestly one of the worst experiences I have ever had the displeasure of doing business with!
The shop manager who thinks he talk to people's  wife's the way he was is simply unexceptional
The service center in my opinion should rebuild the staff because it's not working the way it is! Just read the reviews good luck an stay away
We had the best experience buying our new suv from Gordie!

First apt - I brought my 2014 Volkswagen Beetle (6 speed diesel turbo) & informed part service representative (dude on the phone + again in person at desk) that the clutch pedal was sticking to the floor & a fluid was leaking from pedal. I explained that I had the clutch bled already from another mechanic. This mechanic who has worked on Beetles before, he informed me that it was most likely the slave cylinder that needed to be replaced. I was advised that since he had seen this before to bring into Volkswagen as he did not have the proper equipment & it was not an easy part to get at. I told the dude who answered the phone in parts & service + again in person that I wanted the slave cylinder replaced. Nobody wanted to listen to me. They said they do a better job than the other mechanic & needed to bleed the clutch. I said there was no point in doing it unless they replaced the slave cylinder, too. Volkswagen service did not consider or even want to replace the slave cylinder. They changed my oil + bled the clutch. I said I would NOT be pleased if it just goes within a few weeks like I expected. They also put a sticker on my windshield for my following oil change & messed up the km's on it. Luckily, I noticed my oil percentage going down from the computer.. checked the oil myself + had to bring it to a local mechanic. The sticker said I didn't need my oil changed for another 12 000 km's.... boy, was that wrong. I'm so happy I picked up on this error.

Unfortunately, as I expected, it wasn't even a week of driving it that my clutch pedal started sticking to the floor again. This time around, it got worse much faster. I couldn't even start my car. The computer was telling me to depress the clutch. So, I had to tow the vehicle at my own expense to the dealership again. This time around, they suggested replacing the master cylinder & could NOT explain why they thought it would be the master cylinder & not slave cylinder. They said it was the cheaper option. I said, "I don't want the cheaper option." I made it clear that I simply wanted the option that would fix my car + prevent this issue from arising again. They would not listen to me. I even asked to speak w parts + service manager. One employee even rolled their eyes at me. They said at this point in time, the best solution they could offer was changing the master cylinder, & if it did NOT fix the issue, then their next recommendation would be to replace the transmission. Again, there was no explanation given as to why this would be better than replacing the slave cylinder, as I stated from the beginning. They said it was their recommendation & could not justify their reason behind it when I questioned yet again.

I am pretty disgusted at this point. My daughter & I were driving to a banquet, and out of nowhere's, there was no indication that the clutch pedal was going to stick... no warning signs like the other 3 times. Luckily, neither of us was injured, & nothing happened to my car besides struggling to keep my clutch depressed after changing gears. I missed my daughter's banquet. She had to hop in another vehicle and attend the banquet without me. I was stuck in gears because the pedal wasn't working. I knew not to shut off my car... I made it to my local mechanic's garage, and it's been parked there since Oct 28th.

So not only did I pay for a master cylinder that didn't need to be replaced, along w the labor costs, I shouldn't have had to pay for a tow... after they bled the clutch without replacing slave cylinder.  Now, I am looking at more expenses to get my rig to the dealership (doubtful I will be going back to Sydney Volkswagen - unless they plan on retifying this situation). I also could have blown my motor.. from their error on the sticker, as they put on w the wrong amount of km's until my next oil change.

Also, maybe the website and information on google  should be updated concerning their hours of operation. I live an hour + 45 mins away. Only open til 5 on weekdays and said til noon on Sat. Nobody was willing (at their own convenience) to help...

reviews.text:
Taylor at Bridgewater Volkswagen went above and beyond to make sure I got into the vehicle with all features I wanted/needed!
I traded in my old vehicle and they made the process super easy. All around friendly and helpful staff/team there! I will definitely be back when it’s time :)

We bought a used SUV yesterday from Art and it was a quick and easy purchase! In less than three hours, we were out the door with everything completed at the DMV. We'll be seeing you all soon for an Atlas!
Was an awesome experience! Art and the staff, especially Rhonda were a pleasure to deal with. Staff were quick to respond to all of my concerns via phone/text/emails, making this an easy choice.

We recently traded in our Toyota Venza for a new Tiguan. The purchase was very easy and we received top dollar for our trade.  Serena, Rhonda and Ty provided excellent customer service. Would highly recommend Bridgewater Volkswagen. Thanks again for such a positive experience. We love our new Tiguan!
Staff were super accessible throughout the process by text/email. Greatly appreciated all the help!

actual_address: 16 Meadow Dr, Truro, NS B2N 5V4, Canada

reviews.text: I had an excellent buying experience at Vantage Motors. They offered me a competitive trade-in valuation. They didn’t try to push any unwanted accessories, warranties, insurances or other packages. There were no surprise fees. They found me the exact car I wanted rather than trying to pressure me into taking something on the lot. If you’re looking for a new VW, visit Barron in the sales room and connect with Pat for financing. For me it was worth the 300 km drive to shop at a dealership that showed me respect and treated me as a valued customer. Other dealers should take note and learn a few things from Vantage Motors.

After our suv broke down on the side of the highway, we had our vehicle towed at the VW dealership in Truro.  Being from out of town, we weren’t quite sure what to expect with the service.  The service department went above and beyond!  They fixed our suv in a timely manner and kept us informed throughout the process. We wish we lived closer so that we could bring our vehicle there for service.  5 stars+++
I had a very smooth and efficient purchase with Angela and staff. Rachel and the detailing staff also did a fantastic job!

I've literally never written a review for a business before but I have to give a MAJOR thank you the service department and the mechanic who worked on my vehicle. They worked with me to ensure I saved money at every single chance, always got my vehicle in quickly, and had open and knowledgeable communication through the whole process. They also went above and beyond to help me with some unexpected work that would have otherwise resulted in me being unable to drive my vehicle for months to come. Judy in the service department was so patient and wonderful to work with; I never had to wonder what was going on with my vehicle, as she regularly updated and answered all of my questions. They even worked around my scheduling difficulties to make the experience as smooth as possible.
The team here was fantastic everyone is so friendly, Brendan the Parts Manager was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.

reviews.text: The level of service Dec 18th was deplorable. Went in for a 1 hour oil change. After 1.5 hours and no completion, asked and was told "just a few more minutes ". That few minutes extended to 1 more hour. 2.5 hours, what a shameful experience. When the car came out, the dashboard was not as we have it, the interior lights didn't come on and the automated service reminder had not been reset. Sloppy service.
Accomodating and fair, gave multiple discounts for diagnoses, customer service is exceptional, flexed to make appointment times work around my schedule. Would recommend

My goodness. The good folks at Valley VW make coming to this car dealership a joy... which very much took me by surprise. I have only dealt with the Service Department, but they have gone above and beyond every time. Special thanks to Gord and Janalee! If you have a VW, get your servicing done here.
Great for all new and used volkswagens, awesome staff, would buy here again

Do not bother buying or taking your car here. They used to be great but since Bruce auto group bought it the whole parts and service team has gone, the booking system is appalling and the service is non existent. I used to take both my cars there, no longer, my Tiguan has free servicing and it's a fight to get valley to honor that, all they want to do is sell me a  package. It has two years free servicing, last time either car will go there. The pricing has gone though the roof and the service has plummeted, avoid at all costs

actual_address: 90 Kelsey Dr, St. John's, NL A1B 0T2, Canada

reviews.text: Probably the worst dealership in the city as far as service goes. Terrible experienced at Volkswagen St. John’s. The customer service is abysmal—staff are rude, unhelpful, and dismissive. On top of that, they constantly try to upsell unnecessary services and overcharge for basic repairs. It feels like they’re more focused on ripping off their customers than actually providing quality service. I won’t be going back and would not recommend this dealership to anyone.

Great initial experience. So far I have only dealt with the sales side here at VW St John’s. Muneeb is definitely the guy you want to look for when you go there, or are simply looking for some information. He has the right altitude, people skills, and motivation. I think he went a little above and beyond for me. Best experience when dealing with any automotive dealership on the Avalon here in Newfoundland to date.

Muneeb was fantastic to deal with when purchasing my new VW! He was helpful in ensuring I selected the right trim package based on the features I was looking for without being pushy. He was super professional, I highly recommend.
Overall great experience!

WORST customer service ever. I had my 2020 Tiguan towed to the dealership due to an issue with it not starting. They took it in for what they called a “no start” appointment. After diagnosis it was found the alternator was gone, only 120,000 kms on the car. I had that repaired along with the front and rear breaks. After leaving the dealership post repair the AC was no longer working - it had been working before - I returned to the dealership and the shop foreman took a Quick Look and said “well it has nothing to do with the repair we did” also had the service person I was dealing with reassure me that it had nothing to do with the repair. After spending a sum of money out there I asked well can it be taken in to diagnose since it was working before and they told me it would need an “AC appointment” which they only book two per day and have a wait list already, next appointment being in September. So now I am expected to drive in the hottest parts of the summer with a newborn baby with no AC. Do better Volkswagen. Last one I will be buying

Even though I love my Tiguan I will be switching to a new dealership. Coming from someone who works in sales, it is absolutely astounding the lack of response and zero follow up to a sales inquiry by the VW team. A sales team who put no effort into making a sale or retaining existing business. And this is not just one bad example, it has been my complete experience across the board over the last 7-8 years dealing with multiple members of Volkswagen in St.Johns. For the price, the service level is terrible. Extremely expensive parts, slow turnaround times, never offer a loaner suv. Do yourself a favour and hire a customer success management team to help retain your customer base.

reviews.text:
I had a very relaxed good experience with my used car purchase there.
Salesperson JB and administrative person Melissa were very pleasant to work with.
Quite the refreshing change from the usual odious bartering transaction you typically get when buying a car.
Definitely recommending to my friends and family.

Awesome experience here. I had researched dealers in the area on Google before selecting Brantford, and the public was not wrong. Dave and Mel were terrific, easy going and very helpful. I had a couple of requests when purchasing a new vehicle and they were accommodating the whole way. Would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone in the market for a new vehicle. Worth the drive even from the GTA!

I just purchased a used Jetta from Brantford VW.  It was an incredible experience.  JB and Angela went the extra mile and then some to make sure everything went smoothly.  I highly recommend this dealership.

Will start off by saying we have always experienced good, but slow service at the Brantford VW location. Booked an appt 1.5 wks ago for a new hitch. When the appt was made it was expressed then that we would drop and wait, We didn't have a have a full day to wait. Car was dropped off Sunday night for a 9am Monday appt. We called st 9 to remind them that we had a 12:30 deadline…. The wheels fell off right then. She advised she “would do her best”

Arrived at the dealer shop at 1045 and car was sitting in the parking lot. We were happy that the job was completed!
Went into see a service adviser and they let us know that the car hadn’t been in yet….!?
The adviser was then very dismissive when we shared our time concern and said “ what would You like me to do?” I said then would You have a loaner car? “His response “well no”

Service manager comes out and states “Your 9am is for the service adviser not for the shop and You need to communicate better with Us your time constraints”

…Umm Sir, we were very specific of our “time constraints” when We booked and were told it was “just a two hour job and would be done in plenty of time”. Service Manager was “shocked” by this statement! There was a 3.5 hrs allotted for a 2 hr job. But of course they over book.

Then to make matters worse when the car did finally go in after 11am the service technician had Our car door open and was smoking at the car. Service Manager was a little surprised when I took issue with this!
Then a woman pulled up to the  with a Jetta (no appt) and our technician began to help Her…?!! And brought out a computer to clear codes etc…
Seems like we will be making a drive elsewhere for future service and maintenance needs.

**update. The service manager did come back out to Us at 1215 and offer a loaner car as we needed to get my F.I.L. To an important medical appt at a Toronto hospital. (Thus our time constraint). That was very appreciated!  He did also give Us two coupons for a detailing. Thank You for hearing Our concerns, and speaking with Your team about importance of communicating customers needs within the team.

My wife and I went to Volkswagen to purchase our first car together and we definitely made the right choice. JB and Mel made the process super easy and helped us pick out a vehicle we quickly fell in love with. I highly recommend Brantford Volkswagen!

reviews.text: It was a pleasure to have done business with Jonathan for the purchase of my new car! It has been said that "Business is not personal, " to the contrary.  I had a personal experience with Jonathan and felt very comfortable making the decision on my new car.  Very knowledgeable, did not "push" the sale, everything you want when you walk into a dealership.  Logan was fantastic when I picked up the vehicle and confirmed that I had made the right choice in choosing my car and the dealership who provided it!

I had a great experience working with Jonathan at Volkswagen Newmarket. After visiting multiple dealerships and checking out other Volkswagen locations, Jonathan was by far the most helpful and knowledgeable. He took the time to answer all my questions, made the process smooth, and helped me find exactly what I was looking for. Highly recommend reaching out to him if you’re in the market for a car!

Recently purchased a Golf R and worked with Jonathan Muir.
I went to two other VW dealerships and had an unpleasant experience with the sales guys when inquiring about this specific model.
John was knowledgeable on the car, willing to help me get a good deal and made the buying process easy.
Will recommend John to anyone looking at a VW.

A couple weeks ago we walked in just to brouse Rob Asrderakhshan came to greet us like family and that felt wonderful warm. We had no intention of purchasing the car that day because we were comparing prices & being our 1st new dealer car we dint want to break the bank. But he was so open and his honesty with us and the deal he got us no other dealer would beat it. We already had looked around so we new what we were dealing with. We ended up buying the car. His honesty and making sure we got a great deal made us at ease. We highly recommend Rob he is wonderful ask for him. Thank you very much Rob ☺️

I had an excellent experience working with Jonathan Muir at Newmarket VW. From the moment I walked in, he was incredibly helpful and attentive without being pushy. He took the time to understand what I was looking for in a vehicle and provided several great options based on my needs and budget. Throughout the entire process, Jonathan was knowledgeable, transparent, and made sure I was comfortable with every decision. He even went above and beyond to help with financing options, making sure I got the best deal possible. I never felt rushed and appreciated his professional yet friendly approach. I highly recommend Jonathan to anyone looking for a stress-free and enjoyable car buying experience!
